intro: Fimbristylis furva, commonly known as the pale tussock sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is characterized by its pale green coloration and fibrous, tussock-like growth habit. Fimbristylis furva plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
